intro: Gouldia stipulacea, commonly known as the golden mistflower, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange ray florets. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its vibrant color and compact growth habit. Gouldia stipulacea is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
